summary: The Child Care for Working Families Act aims to increase the quality, supply, and affordability of child care. It establishes a federal entitlement program providing financial assistance to states, territories, and tribes.  The bill defines various terms related to child care, includes provisions for funding, application processes, and usage guidelines  It addresses payment rates, quality standards, and access for underserved populations. It includes grants for localities, Head Start expansion, and provisions for universal preschool services.  The bill also amends the Head Start Act to extend the duration of services and increase educator wages.
